meanings.sent1: The experienced coach was able to outcoach his opponent with ease.
meanings.sent2: She managed to outcoach her rival by implementing innovative strategies.
meanings.sent3: The young coach tried to outcoach the veteran by using a magic wand - it didn't work!
meanings.sent4: In the game of chess, strategy can help you outcoach your opponent and secure victory.
meanings.sent5: To outcoach someone, you must understand their weaknesses and strengths better than they do.

meanings.definition: To outsmart or outwit in a coaching situation.
meanings.sent1: He was able to outcoach his friend in the friendly basketball match.
meanings.sent2: The clever coach managed to outcoach the other team's coach with a surprise play.
meanings.sent3: The coach tried to outcoach his players by pretending to be a robot during practice.
meanings.sent4: She used her wit to outcoach her opponent and secure the championship title.
meanings.sent5: To outcoach someone, you need to think one step ahead and anticipate their moves.
